items.title: Ohio Lawmaker Wants to Require Jails to Report Pregnancy Outcomes
items.description: The Cleveland Democrat says “all babies should count,” — regardless of whether their mother is behind bars — to ensure access to healthcare for pregna...

items.title: The Marshall Project Honored in 10 Categories by the Society for News Design
items.description: The competition honors the best in visual journalism and design in the world.

items.title: Uncounted: Ohio’s Failure to Track Lost Pregnancies in Jails Spurs Questions Over Care
items.description: One woman’s pregnancy ended in the Cuyahoga County Jail amid ignored cries for help and an “egregious performance failure” by medical staff.

items.title: DOJ Shakeup May Put Civil Rights Probe of 1970 Jackson State, Mississippi, Killings At Risk
items.description: The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Act made way for investigations of racially motivated killings. The federal agency enforcing it is in disarray.

items.title: These Missouri Prisons Get ‘Brutally Hot.’ In Solitary, It’s Even Worse.
